data.title: Good to see it re-open
data.text: This place has been closed for years but earlier this year reopened. It's good to have another bar and this one is very friendly, with guest beers/ciders, good food (if a little pricey), and entertainment several nights a week. Well worth a visit.

data.title: Mediocre and overpriced
data.text: Almost gave 2 stars, but went with three because the food wasn't bad, it was just unremarkable. If I could rate just the service, this would have been a one star rating. Our waitress was also the one who seated us and took our drink order, so she definitely knew we were there. Three tables were seated after us and their orders were taken before ours was. That's always irritating. $14 for a sandwich, and $8 for a draft beer is overpriced. On the bright side, decor is cute and they do have a dance floor.

data.title: Nothing Rusty but the decor
data.text:
A friend had visited earlier in the,week, and despite the few bad reviews posted, I decided to take my husband here for dinner. I AM GLAD WE CAME.
Our server Sarah was the most friendly and attentive. We asked for some fruit for my 3 year old grandson, we were thinking just a few orange slices. She came back with a plan full of fruit, (when little man is happy WE all are happy). I ordered the chicken and waffles, my husband had ribeye. Most delicious and tender. The chicken and waffles comes fried with a half of chicken.  I told Sarah that we were celebrating my husband's birthday, she said, "don't worry I'm working on something for him." It was a waffle covered, with blueberry and chocolate sauce, vanilla ice cream topped with whipped cream..HAPPY BIRTHDAY indeed!!  We will definitely be back. If you ate ever in the high desert stop and have dinner, you won't regret it.

data.title: Lovebugs5
data.text: Would not recommend this restaurant. We ordered ribs when they first opened and could not even chew them they were horrible. The service was horrible complained about the ribs didn't seem to care. Worst place in town to eat wouldn't Their prices are high quality of food is horrible.

data.title: Finally a great steakhouse in Apple Valley
data.text:
I didn't catch the name of the young hostess, very nice, friendly, blonde.
Our waitress, Rebecca,  was very sweet, helpful, friendly, happy person, made our first time visit very nice.
Food was great, my husband 's steak was cooked just the way he liked it, I had the special, pork chops in a honey glace w/apples, grilled vegetables were good (maybe a bit over cooked), the bacon/jalapeño mac and cheese was wonderful, my husband was drooling over my plate,  too. Might be nice if you added mushrooms to your menu to top on the steaks with onions.  Great service, great food and we don't have to travel 20 mile to Victorville for a great steak.  Thanks, we'll be back.

data.title: New Steakhouse in Apple Valley
data.text:
I've been waiting for the Rusty Bull to open ever since they put up the open soon signs. 

The restaurant has been thru several transformations. The original place was great, but declined over several years, the replacement restaurants have been OK, but nothing special. 

I'm glad to say that has changed. The Rusty Bull is the best steakhouse in Apple Valley and most likely the best in the High Desert. 

I ordered the Trigger - a New York strip steak, and couldn't have been happier. Well cooked (med-rare) and really favorable. 

Staff was friendly, we were seated quickly and the food was served fast.

Only had one issue, the waitress didn't bring our salads before the main course, but they are all pretty new, so I think they will improve.

Keep in mind, they open at 4pm. They do not serve breakfast or Lunch.
